{"step_by_step_thinking": "The metyrapone stimulation test is used to evaluate the function of the hypothalamic-pituitary-adrenal (HPA) axis. By inhibiting this enzyme, metyrapone leads to a decrease in cortisol production. In response to the decreased cortisol levels, the hypothalamus releases corticotropin-releasing hormone (CRH), which stimulates the anterior pituitary to release adrenocorticotropic hormone (ACTH). ACTH then acts on the adrenal glands to increase the production of 11-deoxycortisol, which is a precursor to cortisol.
